instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.S5_PWR_EN: What is S5_PWR_EN? S5_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on all S5 power rails when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
HI Guys. Needs some advice here. Liquid damaged board which was working until i cleaned it and rebuild the affected circuit. The damage was on and near <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. Now i have a green light and orange when battery plugged in and on power supply pulls 0.020amps. 
Thanks :)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Broken traces I suppose.
Check continuity from that area with the rest of board; some traces go inside PCB.
Also be sure to have good resistors there.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Cannot find anything wrong with traces. Resistors measure is fine. Around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> i only have voltage on <CAPACITOR>C7622</CAPACITOR> pin 1 and on <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> 8-9pin...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Nothing on pin 12/<CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. Measuring on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> i get:
<SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 3.42v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5v
<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.4v
<SIGNAL>P5VP3V3_VREF2</SIGNAL> 2v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 3.4v

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: If you have 5V at L7520, then you have a broken trace...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
HI 2informaticos. Solved by replacing the <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> don't really know what happened but this board was a mess. Had another one in the meantime liquid damage around <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and solved it the same.

Thanks for you help much appreciated
